page.title: 14RELIGION-GALSTON
page.content: The main place of worship in Galston is the Parish Church which has a congregation of 1250 followed by St. Sophias with 450.There are two smaller houses of God,the Evangelistic and the Church of God.The largest of the two churches was built in 1850 and the other in 1809.In a study of the Parish Church it was revealed that only 25% of the congregation went to church every week.Out of this 25% were under the age of 20;65% between 20 and 65 years and 15% over 65. The people of Galston form a well integrated community although some people are very aware of the different traditions of the two denominations. There is however almost no religious friction in the town.
